title: VariantInterpretation
description: An assertion about the pathogenicity of a genetic sequence variant, based on evaluation of one or more lines of evidence

description.description: A human-readable description of the entity

agent.description: A person, group of people, algorithm, or some other actor that could make a contribution

type.description: An explanation about the purpose of this instance.
An explanation about the purpose of this instance.

qualifier.description: Use NOT as the value of this property to assert that the statement is negated.

contribution.description: The contributions (agent, time and role) made to this entity

description.description: A human-readable description of the entity

allOf.description: A statement that describes the expected effect of a variant allele at the level of genomic or transcript sequence

consequence.description: Classification of allele based on the manner in which it alters the sequence

contextualAllele.description: The contextual (reference-specific) allele that is being classified

ConditionMechanism.description: A statement about the mechanism underlying a genetic condition (e.g. if that LOF mutations in a particular gene are a known mechanism of disease).

mechanism.description: SO term for a class of variants

gene.description: Gene in which the given variants occur

condition.description: The condition whose mechanism is being described

NullAllele.description: A statement that asserts whether an allele causes commplete loss of function of a gene or gene  product.

CriterionAssessment.description:
Preferred: An assertion of whether sufficient evidence exists to satisfy some pre-defined 'variant interpretation criterion', which defines requirements for a particular type of argument relevant to the pathogenicity of a genetic variant.

An assertion of whether sufficient evidence exists about a particular variant to satisfy some pre-defined 'variant interpretation criterion'.

(then see clarifying comments to the right)

IndividualCondition.description: A statement about whether a individual is affected by or exhibits a particular condition

individual.description: The person being assessed for the condition

condition.description: The condition that the person may have

individualHasCondition.description: Whether or not the person has the condition

FamilyCondition.description: A statement describing the presence of a particular disease appears in the history of a family.

proband.description: The person that was the original source of the condition in this family

condition.description: A condition that the family may or may not have

familyHasCondition.description: Whether or not this family has the stated condition

IndividualAlleleInheritance.description: A statement about the origin of a particular allele in an individual - i.e. whether it occurred  de novo in the individual as a result of a spontaneous mutation event, or whether it was inherited from a parent.

canonicalAllele.description: The allele whose denovo status is being described

individual.description: The individual whose allele may be denovo

AlleleFunctionalImpact.description: A statement describing a particular experimental result about the impact of an allele on gene product function (typically that of the directly affected gene).

assayType.description: Specific type of functional data collected

contextualAllele.description: Allele defined with respect to the measured transcript

gene.description: Gene to which the functional data applies

CaseControl.description: A statement describing allele frequencies identified in a particular study group as a function of case-control status (i.e frequency in affected vs unaffected study groups

canonicalAllele.description: The allele studied in the case-control experiment

condition.description: The condition studied in the case-control experiment

oddsRatio.description: Ratio of the probability of having the condition given the allele to the probability of the condition without the allele.

caseGroupFrequency.description: The group of individuals with the condition

controlGroupFrequency.description: The group of individuals without the condition

confidenceIntervalLower.description: Lower bound of the confidence interval for the odds ratio

confidenceIntervalUpper.description: Upper bound of the confidence interval for the odds ratio

SequenceLocation.description: The location of a sequence feature as specified by  the coordinates of its starting and ending residues relative to some reference sequence.

referenceSequence.description: Sequence on which the region is defined

start.description: Start of the region in 0-based coordinates

stop.description: End of the region in 0-based coordinates

AlleleFrequency.description: A statement that describes the frequency of an allele as determined in a defined group of individuals (typically a representative sampling that serves as a proxy for some larger population of individuals

ascertainment.description: The criteria applied to create the dataset in which the frequency was measured

allele.description: The variant for which the frequency is given

alleleCount.description: Frequency numerator: number of times the allele was observed

homozygousAlleleIndividualCount.description: Number of individuals in the group that are homozygous for the allele

heterozygousAlleleIndividualCount.description: Number of individuals in the group who are heterozygous for the allele.

population.description: Ancestry of population or group over which the frequency was measured

hemizygousAlleleIndividualCount.description: Number of individuals in the group that are hemizygous for the allele

alleleFrequency.description: Frequency of the named allele in the population

medianCoverage.description: Median coverage at the allele site in the data set

RegionType.description: A statement that classifies a particular region of biological sequence as being of a specified type or types  (e.g. using terms from the Sequence Ontology).

RegionAlleles.description: A statement about whether a region of genomic sequence overlaps one or more particular alleles.

allele.description: Alleles that are being explicited assessed as either included or excluded from the region.

outcome.description: Assessed outcome of specified alleles as either included or excluded.

region.description: Region within which alleles are being measured

IndividualAllele.description: A statement describing the allelic state of one or more alleles in the genome of an individual (e.g. zygosity information, or phase relative to a second allele).

individual.description: Person whose alleles the data represents

primaryAllele.description: One allele that the person has

secondaryAllele.description: A second allele that the person has

primaryZygosity.description: Zygosity of the primary allele in the individual

secondaryZygosity.description: Zygosity of the secondary allele in the individual

phase.description: Phase of the primary and secondary individual

BenignMissenseVariationRate.description: A statement about the frequency at which missense variants in a particular region are tolerated (i.e. do not cause a pathological condition)

region.description: Sequence on which the region is defined

value.description: The rate at which Benign missense variants occur within the region

gene.description: Gene that contains the missense variants

FamilySegregation.description: A statement describing the correlation between the presence of a particular allele and the manifestation of a mendelian condition, as inherited through a single family pedigree (i.e. co-segregation of an allele and condition in a single family).

phenotypePositiveAlleleNegative.description: Number of (non-proband) individuals with the condition and without the allele

family.description: Family in which segregation is being tested

phenotypePositiveAllelePositive.description: Number of (non-proband) individuals with both the condition and the allele

phenotypeNegativeAllelePositive.description: Number of (non-proband) individuals without the condition and with the allele

columns.description: Column names for the pedigree data element

affectedValues.description: Map describing how affected status is represented in the pedigree

genotypeValues.description: Map describing how genotypes are represented in the pedigree

pedigree.description: Detailed information about the family structure, affected status, and genotypes in pedigree/linkage format.

inconsistentSegregationsObserved.description: Whether phenotype positive/allele negative or phenotype negative/allele positive individuals are in the family

phenotypeNegativeAlleleNegative.description: The number of non-proband family members that have neither the allele nor the phenotype

AggregateSegregation.description: A statement describing the correlation between the presense of a particular allele and the manifestation of a disease or phenotypes, as determined by examining inheritance patterns across multiple families (i.e. co-segregation of an allele and condition, aggregated across multiple family pedigrees).

totalNumberOfSegregations.description: Total number of segregations across families

familySegregation.description: List of FamilySegregrationData that have been aggregated

modeOfInheritance.description: Mode Of Inheritance used in evaluation of segregation

totalOfAllelePosConditionPosIndividuals.description: Number of individuals across families that have the allele and the condition

totalOfAlleleNegConditionNegIndividuals.description: Number of individuals across families that lack both the allele and the condition

totalOfAllelePosConditionNegIndividuals.description: Number of individuals across families that have the allele but not the condition

totalOfAlleleNegConditionPosIndividuals.description: Number of individuals across families that do not have the allele but do have the condition

totalOfUntestedConditionPosIndividuals.description: Number of individuals across families that have the condition but whose allele is untested

totalOfUntestedConditionNegIndividuals.description: Number of individuals across families that do not have the condition but whose allele is untested

totalOfFamiliesWithInconsistentSegregati.description: Number of families containing segregations that are inconsistent with the allele causing the condition

InSilicoPrediction.description: A statement based on the output of a computational algorithm that predicts the impact of a particular allele on the function of its resulting gene product (e.g. 'deleterious', 'damaging', 'tolerated').

transcript.description: The contextual allele on which the prediction is made

canonicalAllele.description: The contextual allele on which the prediction is made

predictionType.description: The type of prediction being made

algorithm.description: The computational tool or algorithm that makes the prediction

LocusHeterogeneity.description: A statement that reflects the specificity with which a genetic condition is caused by variants in a particular gene or locus (i.e. whether it is the only known gene associated with the condition, or one or more other genes have been linked to the condition).

condition.description: The condition for which the eitiology is defined

specificity.description: Specificity of the Gene for the Condition

ConditionPrevelance.description: A statement describing the frequency of a condition as determined for a particular population of persons (ascertained by factors  such as ethnicity, race, socio-economic  status, geographic residence, etc).

condition.description: Condition for which the prevelance is described

minimum.description: Minimum bound on the condition's prevelance

maximum.description: Maximum bound on the condition's prevelance

population.description: Population over which the prevelance is defined

prevelance.description: Prevelance of the condition in the population

ConditionPenetrance.description: A statement describing the proportion of individuals carrying a causal allele who exhibit a particular disease or phenotype.

condition.description: Condition for which the penetrance is described

AlleleConservation.description: A statement about the degree of evolutionary conservation of an allele across a defined set of taxa/species.

allele.description: The allele for which conservation values are given

algorithm.description: Method or program used to calculate conservation

score.description: Numerical score for the conservation of the allele

qualifier.description: Use “NOT” as the value of this property to assert that the statement is negated.

contribution.description: The contributions (agent, time and role) made to this entity

description.description: A human-readable description of the entity

variant.description: The variant whose pathogenicity is being described

condition.description: The condition for which the variant's pathogenicity is described

outcome.description: The coded pathogenicity of the variant for the condition

assertionMethod.description: The  framework that formally defines the methodology used in creating this interpretation.
